intro: Carpotroche integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leafed carpotroche, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth-edged and have a broad, ovate shape. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often have a pale yellow to white color. The plant is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and thrives in areas with moderate to high rainfall.
